abstract.shortdesc: In this situation, everything is still running (lifecycle manager, control plane nodes, and compute nodes) but you want to restore your Swift rings to a previous state.

body.p: In this situation, everything is still running (lifecycle manager, control plane nodes, and compute nodes) but you want to restore your Swift rings to a previous state.
body.note: Freezer backs up and restores Swift rings only, not Swift data.

ol.li: Log in to the first Swift Proxy (SWF-PRX[0]) node.
Source the backup environment file: source /home/stack/backup.osrc
Get the id corresponding to the job "HLM Default: Swift restore from Swift."
This will take some time. While you wait you can follow the progress in the /var/log/freezer-agent/freezer-scheduler.log log file.
Log in to the lifecycle manager.
Stop the Swift service: cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts swift-stop.yml
Log back in to the first Swift Proxy (SWF-PRX[0]) node.
Log back in to the lifecycle manager.
Reconfigure the Swift service:\ cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts swift-reconfigure.yml

body.p: Follow the same procedure as for Swift in the section immediately preceding this one, but select the job "HLM Default: Swift restore from SSH."
